EmailTemplate.name: Post VMworld Email Net New.Send
EmailTemplate.subject: 5 Best Kept Secrets Of VMworld 2015
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<http://vmturbo.com/resources/the-state-of-latency-containers-microservices-e-book?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=latency&utm_content=09102015> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=}},
The dust has settled, the final song has played and everyone has gone home, that's a wrap for VMworld 2015. Or is it...we want an encore, which is why we put together this list of the 5 best kept secrets from VMworld 2015.
- Intelligent Workload Management (IWM) was invented in 2009 - - Those weren't booth babes <http://www.iamnotaboothbabe.com/> - Chances are that was Zerto's own Jennifer Gill you were talking to. Zerto's campaign challenging the stereotype of women's roles at tech conferences has exploded since 2014. You can get your own button here <http://www.iamnotaboothbabe.com/>. - VMTurbo - We still have t-shirts <http://vmturbo.com/request-vmturbo-shirt/>. - If you didn't get a t-shirt from us, or just want another one (we don't blame you), then click here <http://vmturbo.com/request-vmturbo-shirt/> to request your free engineer3 t-shirt.
